title: Typical.

embed.description: Rengar Q has essentially been reverted to what it was original, an on-hit AA buff.

body:
_(sigh)_ 

So, again, how'd that short term solution turn out for you?
Maybe, just maybe, half-assed class reworks aimed at he current meta weren't a good idea.
But it's not like people have been saying that from the start or anything..

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

replies.body: as someone whos oneshot and been oneshot i never really see rengar in my games anymore neither have i really played him since the rework, the ap looks fun and i dont mind seeing him,

I mean even with his reworked Q he was still one shotting, the only difference was that his reworked Q was dealing damage to all targets in the area. Essentially, unless you were building AP, the old rengar could only deal insane damage to one target. Still unfair but I think that the old one is better than the new one, both for rengar players and people playing against rengar.

I played {{champion:107}} when he was first released, and he was fun as fuck then.
Then he got nerfed and buffed (and then nerfed and buffed) and changed, a million fucking times.

I don't like to play champs that change constantly, I never know where I'm at with them.

I admit the double jump from bush was crazy, but aside from that, I liked original Rengar.

I mean more annoying is that, essentially from his old version (the problem version) to the new one (the one with this update) will just basically be a buff where his W can take away CC.

The rage (or whatever his bar is called) mechanic change is kinda minor in the change over.
